content: My husband recently got deployed and I am stuck at home with my 2 year old daughter. We are bored out of our minds!!!! Can anyone please tell me places that would be fun for us to go that are around camp zama???? Preferably no futher than an hours driving time or on the train. Also if you can give me directions that would be even better. Thanks so much

The 3 yrs I spent in Japan my Buddy was at Camp Zuma. I may be wrong and according to google I am , But But driving semi from Yokosuka to Tacikawa AFB I passed it on every trip and some even went in to see my buddy and have lunch. Rule #1 but if I am wrong I am wrong Rule # 2 always forget Rule # 1 SEABEE'S "CAN DO", "HAVE DONE", AND WILL DO SO FOREVER. GOD BLESS AMERICA

content: Have you tried the base website? http://www.usarj.army.mil/ Under "Local Information" there is Morale, Welfare, & Recreation... Other than that, with your child being 2 I'd suggest just going to a playground or park (when weather permits), see if your local area off base has a zoo or aquarium, there are all sorts of things like that you could do. Or you could always just stay at home and make up games, or have daily movie time. Hope that helps

content: How about going to the library? They usually have story telling for the young folks such as your daughter. Also, have you made friends with any of the other moms in your area?

content: Is there an ASYMCA for that area. Sometimes they will have play time for children of that age. Check with Family Services and see what they offer. If they don't offer anything ask why and even volunteer. Put up a sign at the shoppette and get a group of ladies together to do things rotating houses or play areas.
